Dear High Mount School 116 Parents and Guardians,

On Friday, August 7th, I sent out a communication indicating that based upon the County Health Department guidance, we will begin the 2020-2021 school year with remote learning. While we are disappointed that we will not hear the sounds of student laughter or have the ability to offer in-person instruction, we understand the guidance and will always prioritize safety.

This late announcement has again caused the administration and teachers to regroup and make adaptations to our original Return to School Plan. With that said, we will push back the first day of student attendance to Thursday, August 20, 2020.

Once again, I apologize for the inconveniences this may cause you and your family. We are doing our very best to be prepared and offer the best possible remote learning experience. I assure you, we are committed to making this plan student centered!

Thank you in advance for your understanding.

Sincerely,

Dr. Beth A. Horner
Superintendent

The HMS Family Program provides a platform for character development and service learning projects. Our students become a member of an HMS Family when they enroll, and remain a part of that family until they graduate from HMS. Each family consists of an HMS educator and a child from each grade level. Atleast once a month, HMS families gather to participate in a group activity and/or discussion, typically focusing on a specific character trait, team building, and service learning. Through the HMS Family Program, students develop relationships with children across all grade levels and an adult with whom they may not otherwise have regular contact. The HMS Family Program assists in giving our students a sense of belonging and an opportunity for peer mentoring. #CharacterEducation #HMSFamily
